intro: Myrsine umbellata f. major, commonly known as the large-leaved myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green in color. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. This plant is native to tropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth.
